title: European Space Agency
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA; French: Agence spatiale européenne pronunciation , ASE;[4][5] German: Europäische Weltraumorganisation) is an intergovernmental organisation of 22 member states[6] dedicated to the exploration of space. Established in 1975 and headquartered in Paris, ESA has a worldwide staff of about 2,200 in 2018[7] and an annual budget of about €6.5 billion in 2021.[3]
